oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Soldier's discharge for Joseph Ruston
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Military personnel; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Military discharges
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One-page printed discharge form contains handwritten information concerning the soldier's service, description, civilian occupation, and reason for leaving the military. His company, regiment, and brigade commanders have all signed the discharge. An order of transportation is marked on the form, as well as some accounting information that more properly belongs on a certificate of accounts.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- Adjutant and Inspector-General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Historical Society Civil War Collection, 1860-1982
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Army regulations of the Army of the Confederate States (Article XIX) specify that the Adjutant General's Office should provide blank discharge forms, that no discharge should be made in duplicate, and that the company commanders are to keep those forms "carefully in their own custody."
